intro: Bathya andina, commonly known as the Andean bathya, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
